intro: Ardisia belaitensis, commonly known as the Belait endemic ardisia, is a flowering plant species native to Borneo. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are edible. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
